name: 勞維俊
objective: 課程通過一系列關於城市的文本(文學、電影、建築、或其他藝術），思考人跟城市的關係：文化產物如何呈現城市，和城市設計如何給不同思潮影響。如果都市化成了大趨勢，如果我們當下的存在處境離不開城市及對它的想象，我們就有理由研究城市和建築空間在不同歷史脈絡下如何影響人，和如何閱讀城市這充滿符號的文本。課程會介紹關於城市的著作、論述和理論，也會探討如現代性、後現代主義、全球化、殖民主義、解構等議題。如可能，課程會安排實地考察。
schedule:
Through works of fiction, films, architecture and urbanscape, this course examines how the city is represented in texts and how cities have shaped thinking. We will examine both the visible features of a city (architecture, monumental buildings, preservation projects) and also what Calvino means by the ‘invisible city.’  Cities represented in texts include Manchester, London, Paris, St. Petersburg, Buenos Aires, New York, Shanghai, Taipei, Hong Kong and Macau. Topics concerning modernity, postmodernism, globalization, colonization, and deconstruction will be explored. A field trip may be included if feasible.

Course Outline: 
　　　　
I: Introduction: Into the Nineteenth-century 
　　
Week 1: Introduction 
Jonathan Swift, ‘A Description of a City Shower’ (1710) (poem)　　　　
Blake, ‘London’ (poem) 
Poe, ‘Man of the Crowd’ (short fiction)

Week 2: Dickens’ London
Dickens, Bleak House (ch.1)
Dickens, Little Dorrit (ch.3)
Dickens, A Tale of Two Cities (Book 1, ch.3)
Engels, ‘The Great Towns,’ in The Condition of the Working Class in England (essay)

Week 3: Elizabeth Gaskell, Mary Barton (novel) *　　　　
　　　　　　　　
Week 4: Baudelaire, ‘The Swan’, ‘To a Woman Passing By,’ in The Flowers of Evil (poems)

Week 5: Nikolai Gogol, ‘Nevsky Prospect’ (short fiction)

Week 6: James Joyce, Dubliners *

II. The City in Theory:

Week 7-8: 
Italo Calvino, Invisible Cities (novel) *
Georg Simmel, ‘The Metropolis and Mental Life’ (essay)
Benjamin, ‘Paris – Capital of the Nineteenth Century’ (essay)

Week 9: Mid-term Paper Due (draft due: Week 7)

III. The City and Sexuality:

Week 10: 
Augustus Leopold Egg, Past and Present. Oil on Canvas. 1858. Tate Gallery, London.
Manet, A Bar at the Folies-Bergère. 1881-1882. Oil on canvas. 96 x 130 cm. Courtauld Institute Galleries, London.

Week 11: 
Wong Kar Wai, Happy Together (1997 film). 
Borges, ‘Man on Pink Corner,’ and ‘A Short History of Tango’ (short fictions)

IV. The Surrealist City: 

Week 12: Andre Breton, Nadja (novella) *
Week 13: T. S. Eliot, The Waste Land (poem)

Week 14: 24 City (film) (dir. Jia Zhang-Ke)

Weekend of Week 14 (25-26 May 2013): Field Trip　　

V. The City and Detective: ‘Down these mean streets a man must go’

Week 15-16
Joseph Conrad, Secret Agent (novel) * 
Chinatown (dir. Polanski) or Taxi Driver (1976 film, dir. Martin Scorsese)

Week 17: Presentation (texts on Taipei)

Week 18: Final Essay (draft due: Week 16)
